content.value_statement: An AI skill for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
actual_capabilities: Automate threat modeling with configurable templates and quality checks
Perform comprehensive security audits with deep analysis and automated fixes
Execute penetration testing automation with expert-level configurations
Design and implement secure architecture patterns following industry best practices
Implement cryptographic solutions with proper key management and encryption standards
Monitor and analyze security metrics with performance recommendations
limitations: Requires Python runtime environment for script execution
Security audits depend on code quality and completeness of the target codebase
Penetration testing requires proper authorization and controlled environments
Cryptography implementation requires understanding of security principles
Automated tools may not detect all security vulnerabilities requiring manual review
Some advanced security features may require additional dependencies or cloud services

use_cases.title: Application Security Assessment
use_cases.description: Conduct comprehensive security audits of web applications, APIs, and mobile apps to identify vulnerabilities such as SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, and authentication flaws. Generate detailed reports with remediation recommendations.

use_cases.title: Threat Modeling for New Projects
use_cases.description: Create detailed threat models for new software projects by identifying assets, threat actors, attack vectors, and security controls. Automate documentation and risk assessment using the threat modeler script.

use_cases.title: Security Architecture Design
use_cases.description: Design secure system architectures following zero-trust principles, defense in depth, and least privilege. Implement authentication, authorization, encryption, and monitoring patterns for production systems.

use_cases.title: Penetration Testing Automation
use_cases.description: Automate penetration testing workflows for authorized security assessments including reconnaissance, vulnerability scanning, exploitation, and post-exploitation analysis. Generate compliance-ready reports.

use_cases.title: Cryptography Implementation
use_cases.description: Implement secure cryptographic solutions including symmetric and asymmetric encryption, key management, digital signatures, and certificate handling for data protection requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Conduct Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the security auditor script to analyze the codebase at [path]. Run: python scripts/security_auditor.py [path] --verbose. Review the security findings and provide recommendations for critical and high-severity vulnerabilities.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to assess the security posture of an application and identify vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Create Threat Model
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the threat modeler to create a threat model for [project name]. Run: python scripts/threat_modeler.py [project-path]. Identify assets, threat actors, attack vectors, and recommend security controls.
prompt_templates.scenario: When starting a new project or evaluating security risks for an existing system

prompt_templates.title: Run Penetration Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute an authorized penetration test using the pentest automator: python scripts/pentest_automator.py [arguments]. Perform reconnaissance, vulnerability scanning, and exploitation within the defined scope. Document all findings.
prompt_templates.scenario: When conducting authorized security testing with proper permissions

prompt_templates.title: Implement Encryption
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement secure encryption for [data type] using the cryptography reference guide. Use AES-256-GCM for symmetric encryption and RSA-2048 or higher for asymmetric encryption. Include proper key management and IV generation.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to protect sensitive data at rest or in transit

prompt_templates.title: Design Security Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a secure architecture for [system description] following the security architecture patterns reference. Implement authentication, authorization, input validation, secure communication, and audit logging.
prompt_templates.scenario: When designing the security architecture for a new system or refactoring an existing one

output_examples.input: Design secure authentication for a React Native mobile app
output: 1. OAuth 2.0 with PKCE flow for mobile clients
2. JWT access tokens (15 min expiry) + refresh tokens (7 days)
3. Secure token storage using device keychain (iOS Keychain, Android Keystore)
5. Biometric authentication (Face ID/Touch ID) for app unlock
6. Token refresh logic with automatic session management
7. Logout functionality clearing all tokens and session data

best_practices: Always validate and sanitize all user inputs to prevent injection attacks
Use parameterized queries or prepared statements for all database operations
Implement proper authentication and authorization for all endpoints and resources
Store passwords using strong hashing algorithms (bcrypt, Argon2) with unique salts
Use HTTPS/TLS for all network communications and implement certificate pinning where appropriate
Keep all dependencies and frameworks updated to patch known vulnerabilities
Implement comprehensive logging and monitoring with security event alerting
Follow the principle of least privilege for user permissions and service accounts
Use environment variables and secret management systems for sensitive configuration
Conduct regular security audits and penetration tests on production systems
Implement rate limiting and input validation to prevent abuse and DoS attacks
Use cryptographically secure random number generators for tokens and keys
anti_patterns: Hardcoding credentials, API keys, or secrets directly in source code
Using weak or deprecated cryptographic algorithms (MD5, SHA1, DES)
Trusting user input without validation or sanitization
Implementing custom cryptography instead of using established libraries
Storing passwords in plain text or using reversible encryption
Disabling SSL/TLS certificate validation in production code
Exposing detailed error messages or stack traces to end users
Using GET requests for operations that modify data or have side effects
Implementing authentication without proper session management
Granting excessive permissions or running services as root/admin
Ignoring security warnings from automated scanning tools
Skipping security testing or performing tests only in development environments

faq.question: How do I run the security auditor on my codebase?
faq.answer: Run 'python scripts/security_auditor.py <target-path> --verbose' where target-path is the directory you want to audit. The script will perform deep analysis and generate a report with security findings and recommendations.

faq.question: What permissions are required for penetration testing?
faq.answer: You must have explicit written authorization before conducting any penetration tests. This skill should only be used in authorized contexts such as penetration testing engagements, CTF competitions, security research with proper scope, or on systems you own.

faq.question: Which cryptographic algorithms should I use?
faq.answer: Use modern, industry-standard algorithms: AES-256-GCM for symmetric encryption, RSA-2048 or higher (or ECC P-256) for asymmetric encryption, SHA-256 or SHA-3 for hashing, and bcrypt or Argon2 for password hashing. Avoid deprecated algorithms like MD5, SHA1, DES, and RC4.

faq.question: How do I create a threat model for my application?
faq.answer: Use the threat modeler script: 'python scripts/threat_modeler.py <project-path>'. The tool will guide you through identifying assets, threat actors, attack vectors, and security controls. Refer to the security architecture patterns reference for detailed guidance.

faq.question: What tech stacks are supported by this skill?
faq.answer: This skill supports TypeScript/JavaScript, Python, Go, Swift, and Kotlin. It covers frontend frameworks (React, Next.js, React Native, Flutter), backend (Node.js, Express, GraphQL), databases (PostgreSQL, Prisma), and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).

faq.question: How often should I run security audits?
faq.answer: Run automated security audits on every code commit or pull request as part of your CI/CD pipeline. Conduct comprehensive manual security audits quarterly or whenever major features are added. Perform penetration tests annually or after significant architectural changes.
